intro: Henckelia hookeri, commonly known as the Hooker's henckelia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains in South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. It features small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, and its leaves are often finely divided. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
